subject: Re: [junit] Question.
msgSnippet: Well if class B s method is still not implemented then how about you have Class B method return a predifined value to class A. If class B method is implemented
messageBody:
Well if class B's method is still not implemented then how about you have Class
B method return a predifined value to class A. If class B method is implemented
then maybe you could use polymorphism to make a temporary method signature in
class B. Or, you could use a Mock Object http://www.junit.org/articles.htm

-H

--- selena su <selena.su@...> wrote:
> Hi There:
> Just a question, scenario:
>
> Let say, i have class A and class B.
>
> I would like to write a test case for class A which later will then link
> to class B but the class B's method hasn't completed but i know the
> class B will return a value, is that possible for me to test the Class A
> to link with Class B ? As i just want to make sure the linking is okie
> and my ideas of class B are working fine.....;-)
>
> I hope i won't confuse you guys ! ;-)
>
> Regards,
>
>
